Legal_Issue: Was the applicant denied the right to counsel due to the adjudicator refusing an adjournment?
Evidence_Assessment: No evidence of deliberate delay or prejudice caused by proceeding without counsel
Legal_Rule: The right to counsel requires a reasonable opportunity to retain counsel, but not an absolute right. Adjournments must balance the need for expedition and fairness.
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Case remitted to a new adjudicator
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proceeding without adjournment affected procedural fairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant changed counsel shortly before hearing; new counsel unavailable
Legal_Framework: Right to counsel in immigration proceedings
Applicant_Challenge: Denied adjournment to secure legal representation
Defendant_Response: No prior delays or attempts to stall cited by adjudicator
Outcome: Matter returned to new adjudicator with adequate notice
Legal_Provision: s. 18.1 of the Federal Court Act
Governing_Rule: Right to counsel and fair hearing under administrative law
